metadata.Title: CVE-2020-3898 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in macOS Catalina 10.15.4. An application may be able to gain elevated privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-3898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-bsd - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-client - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-core-drivers - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-daemon - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-ipp-utils - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-ppdc - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-server-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
libcups2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
libcupscgi1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
libcupsimage2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
libcupsmime1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
libcupsppdc1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> as of 2020-04-20, does not appear to have landed upstream

criterions.comment: cups package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8').
